Event.name: Emptying
Event.definition:
<def-root>These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated <fen>Source</fen> because it is the source of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike <fen>Source</fen> in other frames. Some words in this frame, such as <ment>empty</ment>, may also occur with <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> expressions, e.g.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The players</fex> <t>emptied</t> <fex name="Source">the bucket</fex> <fex name="Path">over his head</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that does the emptying. <ex><fex name="Agent">Pat</fex> <t>cleared</t> the table of dishes.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen>, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by "of". <ex>Pat <t>cleared</t> the table <fex name="Thm">of dishes</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the region or container which is emptied of something. In this frame, the <fen>Source</fen> occurs as an NP Object. <ex>Pat <t>cleared</t> <fex name="Src">the table</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex>Kim <t>emptied</t> the basin <fex name="Path">over the edge of the balcony</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion. <ex>The children <t>emptied</t> the toy box <fex name="Goal">onto the floor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depicitive phrase describing either the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen> of the emptying. <ex><fex name="Dep">Naked</fex>, <fex name="Agent">Millhouse</fex> <t>emptied</t> <fex name="Source">the trash can</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This is the object with which the <fen>Agent</fen> empties the <fen>Source</fen>. <ex>I <t>emptied</t> the tub <fex name="Inst">with a bucket</fex>.</ex> <ex>I <t>peeled</t> the oranges <fex name="Inst">with a knife</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying. <ex><fex name="Cause">A basic washing</fex> can <t>degrease</t> <fex name="Source">your workclothes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the emptying takes place.
<ex>Don't <t>eviscerate</t> him <fex name="pla">in the house</fex>!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the emptying takes place.
<ex>The prisoners were <t>deloused</t> <fex name="tim">in June and August</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reason why the <fen>Agent</fen> empties the <fen>Source</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: clear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: free of any obstructions or unwanted objects

lexUnit.name: drain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause the water or other liquid in (something) to run out, leaving it empty or dry.

lexUnit.name: empty.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make a location or container empty, remove the contents of a container

lexUnit.name: purge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to free from impurities, cleanse, rid of unwanted things

lexUnit.name: strip.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove of accessories or fittings

lexUnit.name: divest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deprive or dispossess someone or something of

lexUnit.name: rid.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make someone or something free of (an unwanted thing)

lexUnit.name: disembowel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cut open and remove the internal organs of

lexUnit.name: skin.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove the skin from

lexUnit.name: core.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove the core from (a fruit)

lexUnit.name: peel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove the outer covering or skin from (a fruit, vegetable, etc.)

lexUnit.name: gut.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove or destroy the internal parts of

lexUnit.name: bone.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove the bones from (meat or fish) before cooking

lexUnit.name: debug.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove a bug from; generally used metaphorically concerning incorrect computer code or concealed listening devices.

lexUnit.name: deforest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: clear of forest or trees

lexUnit.name: degrease.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove grease from

lexUnit.name: descale.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove deposits of scale from

lexUnit.name: scalp.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take the scalp of (an enemy)

lexUnit.name: defrost.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become free of accumulated ice

lexUnit.name: delouse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: clear of lice

lexUnit.name: eviscerate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: disembowel.

lexUnit.name: denude.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: strip of covering or possessions; make bare

lexUnit.name: unload.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove a load from.

lexUnit.name: emptying.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of emptying

lexUnit.name: expurgate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rid (a text of account) of matter regarded as obscene or unsuitable

lexUnit.name: void.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: empty or evacuate (a container or space)

lexUnit.name: evacuate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: empty a container (particularly, a building of people, to ensure safety)

lexUnit.name: debone.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove the bones from.

lexUnit.name: devein.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove the dark dorsal vein (of shrimp)

lexUnit.name: disarm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: take a weapon or weapons away from.

lexUnit.name: disarmament.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of causing an individual (organization, nation, etc.) to disarm themselves.

lexUnit.name: decontaminate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove dangerous substances from.

lexUnit.name: decontamination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of removing harmful, often toxic, substances from something.

lexUnit.name: cleanse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: empty of something, as if to clean.

lexUnit.name: pit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove the pit, typically from some kind of fruit

lexUnit.name: seed.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove the seed of something, typically a fruit

lexUnit.name: stone.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove the stone of something, typically a stone-fruit

lexUnit.name: stalk.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove the stalk of something, typically a vegetable

lexUnit.name: flush.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: clear of dirt, debris, etc., by running through with a fluid.

lexUnit.name: expunge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: completely clear of all traces of something.

lexUnit.name: weed.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove weeds (or, metaphorically, undesired elements) from.
